sentence.Network_en: The economy is still an unholy mess.
He screamed unholy things at me.
an unholy alliance between the medical profession and the pharmaceutical industry
sentence.Network_cn: 医疗界与医药业的不当联盟

PerfectNetExp.abs: 施法者可以此光束作为+4邪恶(unholy)长剑战斗。所有相关专长，例如武器专攻(长剑)都能作用。

解救邪恶武器 (Unholy Weapon) 被解救的「邪恶」武器将成为「神圣」武器。 中度塑能系施法者等级7 先决条件:制造魔法武器及防具、「圣光击」、解救者必需为.

means.word_mean: 不神圣的,邪恶的;有罪的

entry.tran: 极不合理的；极令人厌恶的
entry.def: You use unholy to emphasize how unreasonable or unpleasant you think something is.

example.ex: She protested that it wasn't traditional jazz at all, but an unholy row...
example.tran: 她抗议说那根本不是传统爵士乐，而是令人憎恶的噪音。

example.ex: The economy is still an unholy mess.

entry.tran: （由通常敌对的两方或多方组成的联盟）不同寻常的，诡异的
entry.def: If you refer to two or more people or groups working together as an unholy alliance, you mean that this arrangement is unusual because the people usually oppose each other.

example.ex: If the government does fall it will be because of this unholy alliance between the far right and the left...
example.tran: 如果政府真的倒台了，那一定是因为极右翼势力和左翼势力的诡异联盟。

example.ex: Westerners charged that the party was run by an unholy coalition between North and South.
example.tran: 西部人指责说该党被北方和南方不同寻常的联盟所操控。

entry.def: If you describe something as unholy, you mean that it is wicked or bad.

example.ex: 'This ought to be fun,' he told Alex, eyes gleaming with an almost unholy relish...
example.tran: “这一定会很有趣,”他对亚历克斯说，眼神里几乎透出一丝邪恶的光芒。

example.ex: He screamed unholy things at me.

means.word_mean: 2. extremely evil or cruel; expressive of cruelty or befitting hell;

sentences.sentence: "something demonic in him--something that could be cruel"
"diabolical sorcerers under the influence of devils"

auth_sentence.res_content_con: I'd call it macho atheism as preached by unholy warlords.

auth_sentence.content: Still, some part of her rebelled against him, some unholy part.
auth_sentence.res_content: Still, some part of her rebelled against him, some unholy part.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Still, some part of her rebelled against him, some unholy part.
